Ministry of Science and Technology of Thailand

xocs:funding-list.xocs:funding-text: This study was financially supported by the Thailand Research Fund (TRF-RSA6080018) and the National Nanotechnology Center (NANOTEC), NSTDA, Ministry of Science and Technology, Thailand, through its program of the Center of Excellence Network. This work was also partially supported by a Grant for International Research Integration: Chula Research Scholar, and E.R. was supported by a Postdoctoral Fellowship (Ratchadaphiseksomphot Endowment Fund). We also thank Prof. Soraya Pornsuwan for EPR experiment.

organization.$: Nanotec-CU Center of Excellence on Food and Agriculture

head.citation-title: Organocatalytic Visible Light Enabled SNAr of Heterocyclic Thiols: A Metal-Free Approach to 2-Aminobenzoxazoles and 4-Aminoquinazolines
head.abstracts: © 2017 American Chemical Society.The direct amination reaction of heterocyclic thiols has been developed in the presence of the nonhazardous photocatalyst Rose Bengal under irradiation of visible light. The reaction provides a straightforward approach to pharmaceutically and synthetically useful 2-aminobenzoxazole and 4-aminoquinazoline derivatives from the corresponding heterocyclic thiols with amines in good to excellent yields. Our photochemical reaction can be successfully adapted into a continuous flow reactor which is applicable for large-scale chemical industry. The key benefits of this reaction include the use of metal-free, low-cost Rose Bengal catalyst and practical operation (ambient temperature, open flask, and undried solvents).

organization.$: Nanotec-CU Center of Excellence on Food and Agriculture

grant-text.$: This study was financially supported by the Thailand Research Fund (TRF-RSA6080018) and the National Nanotechnology Center (NANOTEC), NSTDA, Ministry of Science and Technology, Thailand, through its program of the Center of Excellence Network. This work was also partially supported by a Grant for International Research Integration: Chula Research Scholar, and E.R. was supported by a Postdoctoral Fellowship (Ratchadaphiseksomphot Endowment Fund). We also thank Prof. Soraya Pornsuwan for EPR experiment.

grant-agency.$: National Science and Technology Development Agency
